commit_message:
Remove ffu converge and perform stack update only.

In the Queens to Train upgrade, the CLI command used for fast forward
upgrade is the same one as for upgrades. Changing the converge step to
avoid calling fast-forward-upgrade converge instead. Also, for this
FFU workflow it shouldn't be needed to re-deploy again during the
converge step, so adding the --stack-only flag when
ffu_overcloud_upgrade is set.

Change-Id: Ief897b15749ff606d0ca3a1a1b12882236f30cb9
(cherry picked from commit 4305196b6c76c32aaead18a615f77c6ffc72cf87)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie762327f9127b2aa75c4e5a3dae5ad384e07b074

commit_message:
Update scn003 to exercise ExtraFirewallrules capabilities

This change will add a couple extra firewall rules to scenario 003
which will ensure we're exercising an optional code path, which
provides a functional example of how we can leverage the feature.

The scenario test matrix has been updated to indicate "extra firewall"
is tested in scn003.

Change-Id: I9db8e2acbacb820c3e8b6b2eb7a8a0dbbae4a089
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I11cc9e15a26cfc663296d6a99a5705d764654b3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 16:36:50.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5186a386be6b79fb3ed31035da5b3e3a162ead92
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5186a386be6b79fb3ed31035da5b3e3a162ead92

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 19:05:48.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I91036721fcb78c8eec234577d3c4f40690fb6eb6
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I91036721fcb78c8eec234577d3c4f40690fb6eb6

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ibc61d209437ae525d5d541d59ccb639dc8b06b26

commit_message:
Remove VxFlex OS credentials from connection_properties

VxFlex OS password is not stored in block_device_mapping table. Instead of this
passwords are stored in separate file and are retrieved during each attach/detach
operation.

Closes-Bug: #1823200

Squashed two changes together since both are needed to fix jobs:

Resolve PEP8

No idea how this happened, but reviews started failing the
pep8 gate job. The failures are legitimate, see the commit.
I guess the pep8 tests became smarter and found these issues.

(cherry picked from commit 52ff421e3d339f81c2625bff429e6829a2d9af67)

Add libc6-dev to bindep

The python-builder base image was updated to no longer install
recommends. This is inline with the other Infra images and keeps
image sizes smaller. gcc recommended libc6-dev - but it turns out
we need that for limits.h for one of our depends. Add it to fix
our image builds.

(cherry picked from commit 97d027caecdb977779ff130bb9ee2b3204c5646c)

Change-Id: Id9a0dad644134dafd68eed37fe8f41c583d7a619

commit_message:
Fix ussuri jobs

Squashed two changes together since both are needed to fix jobs:

Resolve PEP8

No idea how this happened, but reviews started failing the
pep8 gate job. The failures are legitimate, see the commit.
I guess the pep8 tests became smarter and found these issues.

(cherry picked from commit 52ff421e3d339f81c2625bff429e6829a2d9af67)

Add libc6-dev to bindep

The python-builder base image was updated to no longer install
recommends. This is inline with the other Infra images and keeps
image sizes smaller. gcc recommended libc6-dev - but it turns out
we need that for limits.h for one of our depends. Add it to fix
our image builds.

(cherry picked from commit 97d027caecdb977779ff130bb9ee2b3204c5646c)

Change-Id: Id9a0dad644134dafd68eed37fe8f41c583d7a619

commit_message:
Remove VxFlex OS credentials from connection_properties

VxFlex OS password is not stored in block_device_mapping table. Instead of this
passwords are stored in separate file and are retrieved during each attach/detach
operation.

Closes-Bug: 1823200
Change-Id: I10a8aaddbf7dd09830cd4189cd1f99c0ad1f3b60

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 19:52:13.000000000', 'message': "Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ib5308485e50cc076855cc8e1df72b02d208febe1
"}]
commit_message:
Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ib5308485e50cc076855cc8e1df72b02d208febe1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-30 16:41:05.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4c358db3b0aae6370875c61120182443532c8e7b
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4c358db3b0aae6370875c61120182443532c8e7b

commit_message:
Remove VxFlex OS credentials from connection_properties

VxFlex OS password is not stored in block_device_mapping table. Instead of this
passwords are stored in separate file and are retrieved during each attach/detach
operation.

Closes-Bug: #1823200
Change-Id: Iaa337518d6e6542a93d9e4f5d4d72094e9279c53

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-08 14:16:35.000000000', 'message': "Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request

EC2 token requests contain a signature that signs the entire request,
including the access timestamp. While the signature is checked, the
timestamp is not, and so these signed requests remain valid
indefinitely, leaving the token API vulnerable to replay attacks. This
change introduces a configurable TTL for signed token requests and
ensures that the timestamp is actually validated against it.

The check will work for either an AWS Signature v1/v2 'Timestamp'
parameter[1] or the AWS Signature v4 'X-Aws-Date' header or
parameter[2].

Although this technically adds a new feature and the default value of
the feature changes behavior, this change is required to protect
credential holders and therefore must be backported to all supported
branches.

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/signature-version-2.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-date-handling.html

Conflicts due to six removal in e2d83ae9:
	keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py
	keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_ec2_core.py

Conflicts due to v2.0 API testing in stable/queens. The v2.0 tests were
removed in Rocky but in earlier releases we tested similar functionality
between v3 and v2.0. This conflict was resolved by porting the timestamp
to the v2.0 API test:
	keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_ec2_core.py

Conflicts due to flask reorg:
	keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py

commit_message:
Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request

EC2 token requests contain a signature that signs the entire request,
including the access timestamp. While the signature is checked, the
timestamp is not, and so these signed requests remain valid
indefinitely, leaving the token API vulnerable to replay attacks. This
change introduces a configurable TTL for signed token requests and
ensures that the timestamp is actually validated against it.

The check will work for either an AWS Signature v1/v2 'Timestamp'
parameter[1] or the AWS Signature v4 'X-Aws-Date' header or
parameter[2].

Although this technically adds a new feature and the default value of
the feature changes behavior, this change is required to protect
credential holders and therefore must be backported to all supported
branches.

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/signature-version-2.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-date-handling.html

Conflicts due to six removal in e2d83ae9:
	keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py
	keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_ec2_core.py

Conflicts due to v2.0 API testing in stable/queens. The v2.0 tests were
removed in Rocky but in earlier releases we tested similar functionality
between v3 and v2.0. This conflict was resolved by porting the timestamp
to the v2.0 API test:
	keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_ec2_core.py

Conflicts due to flask reorg:
	keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py

Change-Id: Idb10267338b4204b435df233c636046a1ce5711f
Closes-bug: #1872737
(cherry picked from commit ab89ea749013e7f2c46260f68504f5687763e019)

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I739502c3379364aafd2363c09d9a8d539100bf44

commit_message:
Revert "[ceph-osd, ceph-client] Weight OSDs as they are added"

This patch currently breaks cinder helm test in the OSH cinder jobs
blocking the gate. Proposing to revert to unblock the jobs.

This reverts commit f59cb11932e30bb607a580c976871cdecd7a714c.

Change-Id: I73012ec6f4c3d751131f1c26eea9266f7abc1809

commit_message:
Remove support for Ubuntu Xenial and Debian Stretch

They're broken already, no point in officially supporting them.
Bring support back would require supporting Python 3.5 and other
old packages.

Change-Id: I8012f0cdf2430723379367eb6ab49c3fc0b3d32a
(cherry picked from commit 979bcae918e8c270177b2deba79d52e225a8eb2b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-27 09:13:42.000000000', 'message': 'Force container deletion if namespace does not exist in service_kill

When a service is stopped using "service_kill" script and the
namespace where the container is running does not exist, the
container process should be forced to stop from the root namespace.

A namespace where a process is running, can be deleted whitout
stopping the mentioned process. "ip netns identify <PID>" then
returns an empty string (root namespace).

If the namespace where a container was executed is deleted,
"service_kill" script should execute a container related command
from the root namespace. To access to the root namespace from
inside a container, running in another namespace, it is necessary
to gain access via "nsenter", specifying the parameter "--all" to
access to all namespaces of the target process.

This patch will prevent an endless loop in Neutron DHCP agent. As
reported in the related bug, when a DHCP agent is resync, the DHCP
helper (metadata proxy) is stopped. In case this process stop raises
an exception (for example if the namespace does not exist), schedules
again a resync, creating an endless loop.

This patch combines [1] and [2] in this repository.
[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714517/
[2]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730657/

Change-Id: Ifb7dbfb93a7cf0b50ef15652d83d87f65bdb6221
Closes-Bug: #1868607

commit_message:
Force container deletion if namespace does not exist in service_kill

When a service is stopped using "service_kill" script and the
namespace where the container is running does not exist, the
container process should be forced to stop from the root namespace.

A namespace where a process is running, can be deleted whitout
stopping the mentioned process. "ip netns identify <PID>" then
returns an empty string (root namespace).

If the namespace where a container was executed is deleted,
"service_kill" script should execute a container related command
from the root namespace. To access to the root namespace from
inside a container, running in another namespace, it is necessary
to gain access via "nsenter", specifying the parameter "--all" to
access to all namespaces of the target process.

This patch will prevent an endless loop in Neutron DHCP agent. As
reported in the related bug, when a DHCP agent is resync, the DHCP
helper (metadata proxy) is stopped. In case this process stop raises
an exception (for example if the namespace does not exist), schedules
again a resync, creating an endless loop.

This patch combines [1] and [2] in this repository.
[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714517/
[2]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730657/

Change-Id: Ifb7dbfb93a7cf0b50ef15652d83d87f65bdb6221
Closes-Bug: #1868607
(cherry picked from commit 0bc1383a60c4ab249d16402c37adcea988b84c53)
(cherry picked from commit 05f19f2c596149c19f5005b4b31ccfdb11bc388d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-30 16:42:05.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: If74b848e1f63a0e116737553fec8ab76d63457f5
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: If74b848e1f63a0e116737553fec8ab76d63457f5

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

more info: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt

Change-Id: I3813fe399030475f046023fa7368e8c8526d38ee

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Remove py27 job, py27 fails and not supported anymore in
OpenStack since Ussuri.

Remove unneeded setup.cfg cruft.

Change-Id: Ie22a24f1465420898c0a20efb2773cce2ed6e039

[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:45:42.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]

- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238

Change-Id: I7188b8519e62943ce1ea6fb6cd8dec37d7587d9b
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I7188b8519e62943ce1ea6fb6cd8dec37d7587d9b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 08:50:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix calculating task execution result for "with-items"

* The logic of calculating a task result in case of "with-items" was
  overcomplicated and broke encapsulation of a "with-items" task.
  This patch makes it simpler, so that the method doesn't need to
  peek into the internals of a "with-items" task (e.g. runtime_context).

Change-Id: I036193cbae15d7f3c3414b123525ceafa91fdeb1
'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 09:29:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix calculating task execution result for "with-items"

* The logic of calculating a task result in case of "with-items" was
  overcomplicated and broke encapsulation of a "with-items" task.
  This patch makes it simpler, so that the method doesn't need to
  peek into the internals of a "with-items" task (e.g. runtime_context).

Change-Id: I036193cbae15d7f3c3414b123525ceafa91fdeb1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix calculating task execution result for "with-items"

* The logic of calculating a task result in case of "with-items" was
  overcomplicated and broke encapsulation of a "with-items" task.
  This patch makes it simpler, so that the method doesn't need to
  peek into the internals of a "with-items" task (e.g. runtime_context).

Change-Id: I036193cbae15d7f3c3414b123525ceafa91fdeb1

commit_message:
CI: reduce memory and disk for testing nodes

There is not reason to use 10 or 12G of disk for Cirros.

Also change the RAM to 512M, although we'll have to revert it back
on master and ussuri once we switch to DIB images by default.

Change-Id: Ibada78686ffb4db1d8dae05acf980081d5265fc6
(cherry picked from commit 85e1b8207885d64daf986158dba8768ae49b257e)

commit_message:
Support Debian Buster and add CI jobs for it

Let us extend our supported OS coverage! I also suspect this patch
fixes Debian Stretch support since all required changes seem to
apply to it as well.

Change-Id: I233082dff072ab7033ff68fce7f7b92ad557de80
(cherry picked from commit ccdfa1d02d21a21cf68ddcf7a117966cc43252a0)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I4bd0de2f553c43a805670a424c44455d691891ac

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I60b031ce537e21ce4320aa4f3f60a7f4c75b19c7

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I31b607761241a93bc278c5a4046a3dbbc93dca5d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:22:43.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I029a4125cb36f0238a64c6adee8b9a2cac186e33
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I029a4125cb36f0238a64c6adee8b9a2cac186e33

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-14 08:53:22.000000000', 'message': '[OVN]: Make _delete_port() more error-resilent

This patch is making the transaction from the _delete_port() method in
OVNClient more resilient to errors where elements from that transaction
have already been deleted by another change in the database.

Prior to this patch, a few places could potentially raise RowNotFound
which would abort the whole transaction and would leave the a stable
port for being cleaned up after by the maintenance thread. This patch
tries to catch those exceptions that could potentially fail the
transaction.

(cherry-picked from Neutron I8fd1d1485269d23529a19085bd4aa4c6c74f5f91)

Change-Id: Ib82ae00812922eccee25dcc2752c11aa52a9ceba
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN]: Make _delete_port() more error-resilent

This patch is making the transaction from the _delete_port() method in
OVNClient more resilient to errors where elements from that transaction
have already been deleted by another change in the database.

Prior to this patch, a few places could potentially raise RowNotFound
which would abort the whole transaction and would leave the a stable
port for being cleaned up after by the maintenance thread. This patch
tries to catch those exceptions that could potentially fail the
transaction.

(cherry-picked from Neutron I8fd1d1485269d23529a19085bd4aa4c6c74f5f91)

Change-Id: Ib82ae00812922eccee25dcc2752c11aa52a9ceba
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove support for Ubuntu Xenial and Debian Stretch

They're broken already, no point in officially supporting them.
Bring support back would require supporting Python 3.5 and other
old packages.

Change-Id: I8012f0cdf2430723379367eb6ab49c3fc0b3d32a

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ic428dd362927ea9a799affe623a0ebb2b8aab453

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I51ed3c145a96259b9439d0ffda4685bff9721177

commit_message:
Added publish-openstack-docs-pti job

It takes care of running docs job in check and gate queue
as well as post job is triggered to publish the docs on
openstack doc server based on the project listed in
openstack/governance repo.

https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L79

Change-Id: Ic9e52e9f01ec144e09949235755aa278e2e5c6be
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update scheduler instance info at confirm resize

When a resize is confirmed the instance does not belong to the source
compute any more. In the past the scheduler instance info is only
updated by the _sync_scheduler_instance_info periodic. This caused that
server boots with anti-affinity did not consider the source host.
But now at the end of the confirm_resize call the compute also updates
the scheduler about the move.

Change-Id: Ic50e72e289b56ac54720ad0b719ceeb32487b8c8
Closes-Bug: #1869050
(cherry picked from commit 738110db7492b1360f5f197e8ecafd69a3b141b4)
(cherry picked from commit e8b3927c92d29c74fd0c79b5a51b7a34e9d66236)
(cherry picked from commit e34b375a6161b15d92beba64fa281f40634ffeab)
(cherry picked from commit e1116ee3b776ec84e4ce7d6ac9346fa0d43269b5)
(cherry picked from commit abe04f048c432fed5726af8244bb055e6e44657e)

commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1869050

This patch adds a functional test that reproduce the bug when stale
scheduler instance info prevents booting server with anti-affinity.

Changes in nova test_server_group.py due to
I2cf2fcbaebc706f897ce5dfbff47d32117064f9c is missing from stable/queens

Change-Id: If485330b48ae2671651aafabc93f92a8999f7ca2
Related-Bug: #1869050
(cherry picked from commit b52c483308f32f3744dd8a5df424b9f518c13155)
(cherry picked from commit 016eeec9841116bbbbc6c3019850c18012e3781a)
(cherry picked from commit 66e4d8218133a5e4a68f68a3017446cb585675c4)
(cherry picked from commit 2a15e0096bc87234a930bb75b73d4874f0f7ec87)
(cherry picked from commit 44c47421785ba07d4b238bba06eacc42827c84ab)

commit_message:
Support Debian Buster and add CI jobs for it

Let us extend our supported OS coverage! I also suspect this patch
fixes Debian Stretch support since all required changes seem to
apply to it as well.

Change-Id: I233082dff072ab7033ff68fce7f7b92ad557de80

commit_message:
Default facility to None in OSJournalHandler class

Use a default value of None for facility in OSJournalHandler
class, as is done in the OSSysLogHandler class.

Neutron started failing with a:

 E1120: No value for argument 'facility' in constructor call

With a recent release of oslo.log.

Change-Id: I5269b82d219fd2377535120d9d266238d50431b3
Related-Bug: #1871840
(cherry picked from commit 184235c26517598d6e60f4db72e095ba061a0d6e)

commit_message:
Ensure security_groups on LBaaSLoadBalancer defaults to empty list

When no security groups is present on the LBaaSLoadBalancer oslo
versioned object it should default to an empty list and not to
None. Otherwise iterations of the security_groups field fails.

Closes-bug: 1881575

Change-Id: I9a98584f80219bf5c2ea414177826a26470d414f

commit_message:
CI: reduce memory and disk for testing nodes

There is not reason to use 10 or 12G of disk for Cirros.

Also change the RAM to 512M, although we'll have to revert it back
on master and ussuri once we switch to DIB images by default.

Change-Id: Ibada78686ffb4db1d8dae05acf980081d5265fc6

commit_message:
Add note for Extended Maintenance

Extended Maintenance does not mean by default that every project is
maintained. It could happen that a project is not actively maintained
or unmaintained or even it's team marked it as End of Life. This patch
adds a note to clarify that.

Also reformat a previous note.

Change-Id: Ib96cefe0645de1201fa06e9150a771d8ab94d2f9

> Are we sure we don't really need in the gate queue (at least
 > non-voting)?

you mean in check queue instead of experimental right? I feel for ceph plugin cases where chances are less to break the stable, running those on demand is enough. We have one case breaking the stable branch so thought of adding it in experimental first and if cases for breaking increase then we can think of moving it to check queue.

Adding it in gate queue is overkill, stable testing in check is more than enough. if anything conflicting merge happens between check and gate queue run(which is rare to rare case for stable break) then we can always revert the things."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-05-27 08:35:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:25:43.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I937b48769403d0c78af5069e29768bb7bcdb7b0b
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I937b48769403d0c78af5069e29768bb7bcdb7b0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 19:47:31.000000000', 'message': "Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic79cb4bc06b3078a1f6ebf6be8664b991b0b956b
"}]
commit_message:
Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic79cb4bc06b3078a1f6ebf6be8664b991b0b956b

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I876e2825da628d51c9977a4eec0c2ef05aed3229
Closes-Bug: #1863021

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 11:37:39.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia700e656b4c2616ccbff32707eb4297a1dafbe3b

* Fix some rendering problems

Change-Id: Ia700e656b4c2616ccbff32707eb4297a1dafbe3b
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia700e656b4c2616ccbff32707eb4297a1dafbe3b

(cherry picked from commit 97d027caecdb977779ff130bb9ee2b3204c5646c)

commit_message:
Add libc6-dev to bindep

The python-builder base image was updated to no longer install
recommends. This is inline with the other Infra images and keeps
image sizes smaller. gcc recommended libc6-dev - but it turns out
we need that for limits.h for one of our depends. Add it to fix
our image builds.

Change-Id: I97950d71bc455c269490812c6597fbe432641733
(cherry picked from commit 97d027caecdb977779ff130bb9ee2b3204c5646c)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I4ef04d18b3a6da5cbf3193330957db7846a7bc8d

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I997db26a6f50d0ff5771c11946c01f942c39a24a

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility

- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]

- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I932c7c332a26bd33ecb59bc299cabf63f63c84b2

commit_message:
[OVN] Blacklist IPv6 hotplug tests

The recently added tests

neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_ipv6.IPv6Test.test_ipv6_hotplug_dhcpv6stateless
neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_ipv6.IPv6Test.test_ipv6_hotplug_slaac

are failing. We haven't yet verified why, but to unlock the Neutron
gates lets skip them for now.

Change-Id: Ib773236b3e38a8cf44225578809ada11aaf50958
Related-Bug: #1881558

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343

The python-builder base image was updated to no longer install
recommends. This is inline with the other Infra images and keeps
image sizes smaller. gcc recommended libc6-dev - but it turns out
we need that for limits.h for one of our depends. Add it to fix
our image builds.

Change-Id: I97950d71bc455c269490812c6597fbe432641733

commit_message:
Add libc6-dev to bindep

The python-builder base image was updated to no longer install
recommends. This is inline with the other Infra images and keeps
image sizes smaller. gcc recommended libc6-dev - but it turns out
we need that for limits.h for one of our depends. Add it to fix
our image builds.

Change-Id: I97950d71bc455c269490812c6597fbe432641733

commit_message:
Postpone Stein Extended Maintenance transition by 4 weeks

As it happened in the past, the Extended Maintenance deadline conflicts
with the Final Release of the actual development cycle. Same way as it
was resolved in that time, postpone the EM deadline by approximately 4
weeks, to a less busy period. Also move the deadline some days to not
to fall to weekend.

Change-Id: I2b502f6b5189bd0f7e6bf0286105ad27da1643c7

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-31 17:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 28062, 'date': '2020-06-03 10:00:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-31 17:50:24.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5ebcd8f2cfa9f44830279679e3d6bcd24212bd93
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5ebcd8f2cfa9f44830279679e3d6bcd24212bd93

these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I2b2f006e0ec145730bec843add4147345797b920

commit_message:
[hca] Pin fedora to 32 until new greenlet release

Eventlet used by many openstack packages depends on greenlet which does
not have a pip release supported by Python 3.9 (default Python version
on Fedora 33). Therefore, pin Fedora to version 32 until new greenlet
release is cut which includes the required fix [0].

Also update default heat_container_agent_tag to victoria-dev.

[0] https://github.com/python-greenlet/greenlet/pull/161

Change-Id: Ice75ae880925cd15c096eb6d1cdabf7f802bccde
Story: 2007264
Task: 39941

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 11:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-03 08:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 11:54:44.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ieb7ce05f6611ad743336a35065402888176c7de3
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ieb7ce05f6611ad743336a35065402888176c7de3

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I3adc259f89f9093fbe9cce1353f5d6f0828271b9

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

commit_message:
Fix small issues rolling upgrade

There are several some issues in current upgrade script.

1. The kubectl command location has changed
2. Before checking the digest of the hyperkube image, better wait
   until the image fully downloaded.
3. Using full name to inspect image
4. Get the correct ostree commit id

Task: 39785
Story: 2007676

Change-Id: I5c16b123683ef1173c22d4e4628c36234871cb93
(cherry picked from commit 4085b87714b5bab5f799d6a39ab8ac2c630c796d)

commit_message:
Fix small issues rolling upgrade

There are several some issues in current upgrade script.

1. The kubectl command location has changed
2. Before checking the digest of the hyperkube image, better wait
   until the image fully downloaded.
3. Using full name to inspect image
4. Get the correct ostree commit id

Task: 39785
Story: 2007676

Change-Id: I5c16b123683ef1173c22d4e4628c36234871cb93
(cherry picked from commit 4085b87714b5bab5f799d6a39ab8ac2c630c796d)

commit_message:
Add reserved ports for some services

Exclude ports from the ephemeral pool ranges that can be shared by
the following services:
* Keystone - 35357
* Qpidd/matahari - 49000
* Clustercheck  - 49000-49001 (xinetd)
* Swift Proxy and Ironic PXE that rely on xinetd - 49001

Closes-Bug: #1820576

Change-Id: I71308a65bea5f59d755b766165dabf5d3e646ee1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I4bc9301f5045848545182ef98e47f343a95904c3

subject: Handle overriding of 'obj_class_from_primitive'
messages:
[{'account_id': 30209, 'date': '2020-04-08 08:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-16 11:53:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Hello,

Some inline suggests and concerns'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-23 16:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-23 16:27:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from from_field_primitive to bug/1874482'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-23 16:27:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-23 16:29:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-04-23 18:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30209, 'date': '2020-04-24 06:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30209, 'date': '2020-04-24 07:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30209, 'date': '2020-04-24 08:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Then, the versioned object represeting a same target in different nodes might be attached with different version, since there might have some nodes in newer nova-xx service version and some in older version in same cluster. It offers the new-to-old version converting method in "obj_make_compatible" method. Likely, we might need a function, such as "obj_make_compatible_from_version", to offer the role of transforming an old version object to this, a bumped version one. 

Dan Smith wrote:

> (1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-03 09:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 08:41:23.000000000', 'message': "call the field object's 'obj_from_primitive' instead of calling object

Given a class inherited from `VersionedObject` and having another
`VersionedObject` attached as its fields object,  with the type
of `ObjectField`, if this class overrides the base class's
`obj_from_primitive` method, it will find that the @primitve
parameter of this subclass function will not always be the subclass's
primitive dictionary.

While we'd better to assume that the @primitive object passed
 to `obj_from_primitive` is the primitive of the object itself.
 We can achieve this by invoking the 'obj_from_primitive' method
for the field object from the field class.

Change-Id: I4ec039cf73cfd54e32b5a22dae391df7fafb9142
"}, {'created': '2020-04-23 16:25:30.000000000', 'message': 'Handle overriding of 'obj_class_from_primitive'

Consider the following object hierarchy:

  Foo
    id (IntegerField)

  Bar
    id (IntegerField)
    foo (ObjectField(Foo))

One can serialize the 'Bar' object by calling the 'obj_to_primitive'
method of a 'Bar' instance, which will call 'to_primitive' for each
field on the object. In the case of the 'foo' field, because it's an
'ObjectField', this will in turn call a 'obj_to_primitive' method again,
only this time the one from 'Foo', leading to additional calls to
various 'to_primitive' functions and, if necessary, additional
'obj_to_primitive' calls.

Things should work quite similarly for deserialization. One can
deserialize a serialized 'Bar' instance by calling the
'obj_from_primitive' class method of 'Bar', which will call
'from_primitive' for each field. Once again, 'ObjectField' instances
result in additional calls to a 'obj_from_primitive' class method.
However, here things diverge. While serialization will result in a call
to the 'obj_to_primitive' method of the object in the field, or the
"child" object, deserialization results in a call to the
'obj_from_primitive' class method of the "parent" object. This means
objects that override the 'obj_from_primitive' method will not see the
correct overriden behavior when the object is embedded in another
object.

The solution is simple. The 'obj_from_primitive' class method is split
into two: the existing 'obj_from_primitive' class method and a new
'obj_class_from_primitive' method, which does the lookup of the child
object within the same namespace as the parent object. The expectation
is that users can continue to override the latter, while the former
should remain untouched.

Change-Id: I4ec039cf73cfd54e32b5a22dae391df7fafb9142
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-23 16:27:24.000000000', 'message': 'Handle overriding of 'obj_class_from_primitive'

Consider the following object hierarchy:

  Foo
    id (IntegerField)

  Bar
    id (IntegerField)
    foo (ObjectField(Foo))

One can serialize the 'Bar' object by calling the 'obj_to_primitive'
method of a 'Bar' instance, which will call 'to_primitive' for each
field on the object. In the case of the 'foo' field, because it's an
'ObjectField', this will in turn call a 'obj_to_primitive' method again,
only this time the one from 'Foo', leading to additional calls to
various 'to_primitive' functions and, if necessary, additional
'obj_to_primitive' calls.

Things should work quite similarly for deserialization. One can
deserialize a serialized 'Bar' instance by calling the
'obj_from_primitive' class method of 'Bar', which will call
'from_primitive' for each field. Once again, 'ObjectField' instances
result in additional calls to a 'obj_from_primitive' class method.
However, here things diverge. While serialization will result in a call
to the 'obj_to_primitive' method of the object in the field, or the
"child" object, deserialization results in a call to the
'obj_from_primitive' class method of the "parent" object. This means
objects that override the 'obj_from_primitive' method will not see the
correct overriden behavior when the object is embedded in another
object.

The solution is simple. The 'obj_from_primitive' class method is split
into two: the existing 'obj_from_primitive' class method and a new
'obj_class_from_primitive' method, which does the lookup of the child
object within the same namespace as the parent object. The expectation
is that users can continue to override the latter, while the former
should remain untouched.

Change-Id: I4ec039cf73cfd54e32b5a22dae391df7fafb9142
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>
Closes-Bug: #1874482
'}]
commit_message:
Handle overriding of 'obj_class_from_primitive'

Consider the following object hierarchy:

  Foo
    id (IntegerField)

  Bar
    id (IntegerField)
    foo (ObjectField(Foo))

One can serialize the 'Bar' object by calling the 'obj_to_primitive'
method of a 'Bar' instance, which will call 'to_primitive' for each
field on the object. In the case of the 'foo' field, because it's an
'ObjectField', this will in turn call a 'obj_to_primitive' method again,
only this time the one from 'Foo', leading to additional calls to
various 'to_primitive' functions and, if necessary, additional
'obj_to_primitive' calls.

Things should work quite similarly for deserialization. One can
deserialize a serialized 'Bar' instance by calling the
'obj_from_primitive' class method of 'Bar', which will call
'from_primitive' for each field. Once again, 'ObjectField' instances
result in additional calls to a 'obj_from_primitive' class method.
However, here things diverge. While serialization will result in a call
to the 'obj_to_primitive' method of the object in the field, or the
"child" object, deserialization results in a call to the
'obj_from_primitive' class method of the "parent" object. This means
objects that override the 'obj_from_primitive' method will not see the
correct overriden behavior when the object is embedded in another
object.

The solution is simple. The 'obj_from_primitive' class method is split
into two: the existing 'obj_from_primitive' class method and a new
'obj_class_from_primitive' method, which does the lookup of the child
object within the same namespace as the parent object. The expectation
is that users can continue to override the latter, while the former
should remain untouched.

Change-Id: I4ec039cf73cfd54e32b5a22dae391df7fafb9142
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>
Closes-Bug: #1874482

commit_message:
Default facility to None in OSJournalHandler class

Use a default value of None for facility in OSJournalHandler
class, as is done in the OSSysLogHandler class.

Neutron started failing with a:

 E1120: No value for argument 'facility' in constructor call

With a recent release of oslo.log.

Change-Id: I5269b82d219fd2377535120d9d266238d50431b3
Related-Bug: #1871840

commit_message:
Remove selinux relabel mount option for neutron

Neutron agent processes launched in containers are failing with
 "Error: relabel failed "/var/lib/neutron": \
  SELinux relabeling of /var/lib/neutron is not allowed"

Possibly related prior patch:
 https://review.opendev.org/#/c/626546/

Change-Id: Ifc7d0cb79214da44d9cd12481f010e2d7d325aa6
Related-Bug: #1881146

[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:41:19.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105

[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343

Change-Id: I602a07fc4517ee053c4bfc25920209a2e7ce4f5f
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I602a07fc4517ee053c4bfc25920209a2e7ce4f5f

commit_message:
Only enable leapp tasks when distribution is correct

To enable idempotence in the leapp process, even if the tasks
complete a previous partial run, we add another condition over
and above the 'UpgradeLeappEnabled' heat parameter which checks
that the distribution is RedHat (CentOS does not support the
leapp tool) and distribution version is 7 (if it's 8 then the
leapp process is complete already for this host).

Change-Id: Ia58e2f7853056d8a4f0a54f35d91743bf0d9f2ed

commit_message:
Fix display of application credential roles

On the application credentials index page the roles
are displayed as a python list: "[b'_member']".

This changes that to be properly comma-separated.

Closes-bug: #1878741
Change-Id: Idfbba05091b563957162b6cb58c2475f9594b0c2

commit_message:
Fix session.domain_context_name existence check

In DEBUG mode this check currently causes a VariableDoesNotExist error.

Fix by using `if x in y` rather than `if x.y`.

Change-Id: I8562eea7ed6819c068d2233a74e139428cb39bf1

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 11:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-03 08:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 11:49:34.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I68f27622bc107b956556128b5808e15325e639f9
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I68f27622bc107b956556128b5808e15325e639f9

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ia9cdcfb75cc91dc5f93f02d07ad389c8c7d622fe

commit_message:
[QUEENS-ONLY] Disable LoggingConfiguration by default

This patch makes it possible to avoid issues with LoggingConfiguration
parameters during stack update.

Resolves: rhbz#1834791

commit_message:
Remote __future__ imports

__future__ module was used for Python 2 and 3 compatibility. We don't
support Python 2 anymore so it's safe to delete these usages.

Change-Id: I508e53c533adacb459e5ae9a61dc74a745efc314

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I238de403288a813ca55346e220464c100d7c51a0
