commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I2b5a285c8bd108b1319ab190c3ff5247d0c7a1e5

subject: Add configuration option to set the entityID
messages:
[{'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2020-05-27 13:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2020-05-27 13:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-05-28 12:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-05-29 10:17:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Looks like there's a problem with one of the test bundles: https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-keystone-saml-mellon/+bug/1881267"}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-05-29 11:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Created https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731730/ to fix the bundle issue, we can rebase this change on top of it.'}, {'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2020-05-29 12:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-02 14:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-02 16:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 08:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The change by itself looks reasonable, however, I think it needs a little bit more work before merging:

1) Per https://docs.oasis-open.org/security/saml/v2.0/saml-core-2.0-os.pdf ("8.3.6 Entity Identifier") is a URI.

Considering how easy it is to get the configuration wrong with SAML, I suggest adding a @property to KeystoneSAMLMellonConfigurationAdapter to validate that the value specified in the config option is indeed a URI. If it is not, set a validation error message so that operators can easily determine what is wrong.

This will involve adding rfc3986 to src/wheelhouse.txt and using the library to validate the content of the config option: https://pypi.org/project/rfc3986/#strictly-parsing-a-uri-and-applying-validation

2) a unit test for this new property needs to be added to test the desired behavior:

2.1) test that if the config option is not specifed, the property returns the previously used auto-generated URL:

keystone_fid_service_provider.base_url + options.sp_auth_path

2.2) that the URI from the config key is used if it it is a valid URI;

2.3) if an invalid URI is specified, a validation error is raised.'}]

Add configuration option to set the entityID

Add option to configure the entityID. If not specified, the
entityID is autogenerated.

Change-Id: I35a0031ef001ccacd562f5e79420dca041bbaacf

commit_message:
Update api: Template Delete

When using the delete template, the graph service receives not path parameters but query parameters,
and the request parameter can be UUID or ID.

Change-Id: Ib4fbf2d0ad4bf48a45ecc4b1cc8f512e15b83132

turn make heavy use of fsync() during package installations.

The time taken to install packages can be roughly halved by converting
fsync() to a no-op via libeatmydata. This is common practice during
the building of CD images, chroots and package building with pbuilder.

commit_message:
Enable eatmydata for apt package manager on AIO builds

The apt package manager uses the underlying dpkg functions which in
turn make heavy use of fsync() during package installations.

The time taken to install packages can be roughly halved by converting
fsync() to a no-op via libeatmydata. This is common practice during
the building of CD images, chroots and package building with pbuilder.

Change-Id: Ib3a736d3072eac8a66ca1f92b81b7b5e34d12327

commit_message:
Default keystone endpoint type is hard coded

The default url should be of type "OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE"
parameter as specified in settings.

Closes-Bug: #1873353

Change-Id: I05ce933e5bd01bf59a52e7d49facce26efa693aa

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ie663eebaa5aacf62320b1a0ea7dd6ef9d832e5c0

commit_message:
[neutron] Unhardcode probes timings

This patch adds ability to unhardcode readiness/
liveness probes timings for those probes which still
were hardcoded. Moreover it introduces
RPC_PROBE_TIMEOUT and RPC_PROBE_RETRIES variables
which are passed to health probe script and
allow to unhardcode RPCtest  timeout and number of
retries

Change-Id: I2e48eed26abb82208a4ac4ae596d27ca8db99c90

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I84ad61a25101e9bcf67908382d272b447b605fd9

commit_message:
Add Fedora 30 based job

The current fedora-latest nodeset corresponds to Fedora 30.
We add a non-voting job to give basic support for it.

Change-Id: Ifc027bcdbb9abad652dfe61fc12ee18650d00a77
(cherry picked from commit d8e8297178a6b2647dcad1cf7440fa9b95677955)
(cherry picked from commit ccfe45816a7e6abc27d0d03792f4b02356f8e8b3)

commit_message:
[nova] Unhardcode readiness/liveness probe timings

This patch adds ability to unhardcode readiness/
liveness probes timings. Moreover it introduces
RPC_PROBE_TIMEOUT and RPC_PROBE_RETRIES variables
which are passed to health probe script and
allow to unhardcode RPCtest  timeout and number of
retries

Change-Id: I2498a14e97557feafbd45c8df3c683f8500026e6

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7a7bf796d3f25e4dd3d1709850729d29497d355e

commit_message:
Add extra settings for rabbitmq_exporter

This adds three new variables:
- skip_queues is for ability to skip metrics for some queues
- include_queues is the opposite parameter for presice setup
- rabbit_exporters is for ability to enable/disable exporter modules

Change-Id: Ia81a9921be6c14ec2035009fd164aab4c912f328

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-01 14:10:31.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5d028974e3feed93ee5883bb3d12f254dbd8099d
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5d028974e3feed93ee5883bb3d12f254dbd8099d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-01 22:00:40.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [OVN] Add logical port to its corresponding subnet port group

Change-Id: I9427badbbe89ef91a3b6ca194aa4e9d8d10b9b72
'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 06:06:47.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [OVN] Add logical port to its corresponding subnet port group

Change-Id: I9427badbbe89ef91a3b6ca194aa4e9d8d10b9b72
'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 19:43:45.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [OVN] Add logical port to its corresponding subnet port group (3 of 3)

The default security group normally includes a rule that allows packets that
originate from the same subnet where the VM is connected:

  direction: ingress, ether_type: IPv4, remote_ip_prefix: "0.0.0.0/0"
  remote_group_id:   <UUID_OF_SEC_GROUP>  <-- same as security_group_id
  security_group_id: <UUID_OF_SEC_GROUP>  <-- same as remote_group_id

  direction: ingress, ether_type: IPv6, remote_ip_prefix: "::/0"
  remote_group_id:   <UUID_OF_SEC_GROUP>  <-- same as security_group_id
  security_group_id: <UUID_OF_SEC_GROUP>  <-- same as remote_group_id

OVN translates them into ACLS that look like:

  to-lport 1002 (outport == @<PG_ID> && ip4 && ip4.src == $<PG_ID>_ip4) allow
  to-lport 1002 (outport == @<PG_ID> && ip6 && ip6.src == $<PG_ID>_ip6) allow

A caveat here is that Openstack operators may chosse remove these rules. As VMs
may use IPv4 DHCP to boot, the removal of these security group rules means that
connectivity to DHCP responder (aka ovn-controller) needs to be ensured via an
explicit rule that is not removable by Openstack operators. That is the purpose
of the DHCP rules of the OVN's subnet port group. This particular port group is
automatically created/removed as subnets are added and they contain the following
ACL as part of creation:

  from-lport  1002 (inport == @pg_<OVN_PG_ID_FOR_IPv4_SUBNET> && ip4 &&
  ip4.dst == {255.255.255.255, <SUBNET_PREFIX>} && udp && udp.src == 68 &&
  udp.dst == 67) allow

This change re-introduces (and fixes) the subnet port group, which was removed in
bug #1790900.

Related-Bug: #1790900
Closes-Bug: #1881316

Change-Id: I9427badbbe89ef91a3b6ca194aa4e9d8d10b9b72
'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 20:05:38.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [OVN] Add logical port to its corresponding subnet port group (3 of 3)

  to-lport 1002 (outport == @<PG_ID> && ip6 && ip6.src == $<PG_ID>_ip6) allow

A caveat here is that Openstack operators may chosse remove these rules. As VMs
may use IPv4 DHCP to boot, the removal of these security group rules means that

explicit rule that is not removable by Openstack operators. That is the purpose
of the DHCP rules of the OVN's subnet port group. This particular port group is

  ip4.dst == {255.255.255.255, <SUBNET_PREFIX>} && udp && udp.src == 68 &&
  udp.dst == 67) allow

This change re-introduces (and fixes) the subnet port group, which was removed in

commit_message:
[WIP] [OVN] Add logical port to its corresponding subnet port group (3 of 3)

The default security group normally includes a rule that allows packets that
originate from the same subnet where the VM is connected:

  direction: ingress, ether_type: IPv4, remote_ip_prefix: "0.0.0.0/0"
  remote_group_id:   <UUID_OF_SEC_GROUP>  <-- same as security_group_id
  security_group_id: <UUID_OF_SEC_GROUP>  <-- same as remote_group_id

  direction: ingress, ether_type: IPv6, remote_ip_prefix: "::/0"
  remote_group_id:   <UUID_OF_SEC_GROUP>  <-- same as security_group_id
  security_group_id: <UUID_OF_SEC_GROUP>  <-- same as remote_group_id

OVN translates them into ACLS that look like:

  to-lport 1002 (outport == @<PG_ID> && ip4 && ip4.src == $<PG_ID>_ip4) allow
  to-lport 1002 (outport == @<PG_ID> && ip6 && ip6.src == $<PG_ID>_ip6) allow

A caveat here is that Openstack operators may chosse remove these rules. As VMs
may use IPv4 DHCP to boot, the removal of these security group rules means that
connectivity to DHCP responder (aka ovn-controller) needs to be ensured via an
explicit rule that is not removable by Openstack operators. That is the purpose
of the DHCP rules of the OVN's subnet port group. This particular port group is
automatically created/removed as subnets are added and they contain the following
ACL as part of creation:

  from-lport  1002 (inport == @pg_<OVN_PG_ID_FOR_IPv4_SUBNET> && ip4 &&
  ip4.dst == {255.255.255.255, <SUBNET_PREFIX>} && udp && udp.src == 68 &&
  udp.dst == 67) allow

This change re-introduces (and fixes) the subnet port group, which was removed in
bug #1790900.

Related-Bug: #1790900
Closes-Bug: #1881316

Change-Id: I9427badbbe89ef91a3b6ca194aa4e9d8d10b9b72

commit_message:
Add kolla template override to remove python3-networking-mlnx

Starting with the ussuri release, python3-networking-mlnx is
added to the neutron-base container Dockerfile.
Since python3-networking-mlnx is not supported in all cases,
this patch adds an override to remove it when the container
is built.

Change-Id: I37497509ec7a61f815247c34c0703a75f18f0b6e
Related-Bug: BZ#1828353

commit_message:
Pin diskimage-builder < 3.0.0 on python2.7

diskimage-builder has dropped support for python2.7[1] in version
3.0.0. We need to pin it to < 3.0.0 for the stable branches that
still use python2.7 and diskimage-builder.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/728889

Change-Id: I681172d66891b69b5cd538d0598968262d90e368

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I46021aa93e28242d0f7dc9d80f598538247a6df5

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I324fa00ed82c82ebb6668784684a07b5febc71b8

commit_message:
Check stack trace legnth

Occasionally, inspect.trace returns an zero length
stack trace while handling exceptions. So make
a stack trace depth check before continueing.

close-Bug: #1881455
Change-Id: I24fd1b785d457cee7d313a0760e649b2c092fc33

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I7cc35696d770e1bf9e87310e5a081e1abe719522

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:03:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 13:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 14:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2020-06-03 03:16:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 12:03:00.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I45295290471a5d8d32fb11ddbb64a8accdb7710a

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I45295290471a5d8d32fb11ddbb64a8accdb7710a

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I9bc74b7d1be322ddc0c284cbacc3e625bc72872e

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I734b87a6e24303ea96550363760c595c536654b5

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2020-06-03 03:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 12:01:07.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7966fa4281dde7e6340d632333ea8f8b84128bde
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7966fa4281dde7e6340d632333ea8f8b84128bde

commit_message:
Pin diskimage-builder < 3.0.0 on python2.7

diskimage-builder has dropped support for python2.7[1] in version
3.0.0. We need to pin it to < 3.0.0 for the stable branches that
still use python2.7 and diskimage-builder.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/728889

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I6e7b744bb8f56b0a237dc27da45635d99f3a0290

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iafd5fb0f99a2b68c6f4a3118bf7d7c3a8881465f

commit_message:
Pin diskimage-builder < 3.0.0 on python2.7

diskimage-builder has dropped support for python2.7[1] in version
3.0.0. We need to pin it to < 3.0.0 for the stable branches that
still use python2.7 and diskimage-builder.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/728889

Change-Id: Ic228f623da72394defff476120d4aea0ac04545e

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I02b83b2d2ffa7e007f8150176ac881a8b6a53495

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/731830/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 20s'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2020-05-29 20:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks! What about squashing the two patches?
We will also have to account for the subnet port group in the maintenance task adding the external id of the subnet to the port group.

Now every neutron subnet will be associated to a) DHCP_Options row and b) Subnet Port Group.

Also the existing ports belonging to a subnet shall be added to the port group of the subnet they belong to upon start.

If you feel more comfortable doing it separately it is fine by me too'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-06-02 22:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Thanks! What about squashing the two patches?

Sure thing. Lucas asked the same. ;^)

 > We will also have to account for the subnet port group in the
 > maintenance task adding the external id of the subnet to the port
 > group.

I will need you to be a little more specific here. I think maintenance task is not aware of subnet pgs, since there is no mapping to/from a security group. BUT I may be missing something important here. Please give me some pointers if you can.

 > 
 > Now every neutron subnet will be associated to a) DHCP_Options row
 > and b) Subnet Port Group.

Is there any work to be done in this context in that (a) scenario?

 > 
 > Also the existing ports belonging to a subnet shall be added to the
 > port group of the subnet they belong to upon start.

done. also fixed cases when port update changes the subnet of the port.

 > 
 > If you feel more comfortable doing it separately it is fine by me
 > too

np. squashing...'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-06-03 01:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

moved into https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733033/'}]

commit_message:
Have vpnaas job definition inherit irrelevant files

The neutron-temptest-plugin-vpnaas jobs are being run
even if files like setup.cfg are updated. Instead of
updating its irrelevant-files definition, update the
default one so it can apply to all neutron* repos.

Change-Id: I36b73c44bf65ef4b467a1cceccea2138ba75dd8d

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/731835/2 : FAILURE in 1h 42m 50s'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-06-02 11:06:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hi Flavio,

I see that in order to fix this problem there's already two reverts: this one and [0]. Reading thru [0] comments it seems that even with these two there are a few more things that needs to be done to accomplish what we want (daniel has mentioned some work on the maintenance task and extra information in the external_ids associating the subnet with a dhcp option entry and also the subnet port groups). I was wondering, would be more elegant/easier to fix this problem as a new patch instead of reverts ?

There's no problem in reusing some code from those reverts in a new patch. I also believe that it would ease backports by doing it as a new patch.

Let me know what u think

[0] this one
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731830/"}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-06-03 01:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

moved into https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733033/'}]

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I9d8b24733842e364fc6ef05b9e9adebae2a66ee5

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I064ba67b95e217426e687b5e3055cc4e5288fb5d

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: If9ca34680b1f8879298697d8fa14f3ba9905e0b6

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I693f6acf5294dc425203281a3e4fb266b6119023

commit_message:
Check if host belongs to a segment

If you query a host passing an existing failover segment but not
the one that is assigned to the host, it still returns the host
successfully. In this case, it should fail with 404 error.

This patch checks if the host belongs to the segment that is
present in the URI. If not, it will return 404 error.

Change-Id: I16256cc2a01696a1d54cb9326aed17b723b87727
Closes-Bug: #1854323

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I51c6ea487e714fc61fe79a42e83a461cb0fed81e

commit_message:
Fix pep8 failures

With an updated flake8, we get some new warnings. Update hacking
directly to version 3.1.0 and fix the problems found.

Note that before this change, flake8 used the default "ignore" list,
this now adds a new ignore list.

Change-Id: Iccbf4f30eb4e542d3824b7782f43eacda29c5a90

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 05:52:34.000000000', 'message': "Node Exporter: Allow Ignored Mountpoints

This change adds the ability to configure the

--collector.filesystem.ignored-mount-points

parameter, which is useful in events where a subdirectory
cannot be statfs'd by a non-root user.

commit_message:
Node Exporter: Allow Ignored Mountpoints

This change adds the ability to configure the

--collector.filesystem.ignored-mount-points

parameter, which is useful in events where a subdirectory
cannot be statfs'd by a non-root user.

Change-Id: Ie2be8c496aa676e9a3fee5434e0c194615f9cdab
See: https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter/issues/703

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I3a0de577d7fc75eb83c143fcf595e01eca676446

commit_message:
Update Octavia grafana dashboard

Made the following changes:
 - Added py38 and removed py37
 - Removed "(non-voting)" from grenade job that is now voting
 - Added grenade job gate panels

Change-Id: I1399c3f2a85a2a392fbbc4fe9b23da2c56012ffe

commit_message:
Use upper constraints when running jobs in stable/ branches

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730199/ considered case
only for branch_override and missed the case when jobs
are running in stable/ branches. This patch fixes the usage
for the missing case.

Change-Id: I58f8c0ea017603b30e4aa043bc2fe41e700b9483

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Iaa0e17158d44ad2ea25adcdcc5f56123a9bb80d1

commit_message:
Always build images in component jobs

This review sets the to_build variable to be true
if the 'component' var is defined - which is true
when running jobs from the component pipeline.

Change-Id: Ia60b56847cc31e65841c9033efb780ee5ee3ddfb

commit_message:
Enable s3api and staticweb tests across all func tests

This patch removed the separate s3api, staticweb functional tests
gate jobs and added them across all other functional test jobs.

Change-Id: Ie1c606132a054defc2b3cc14a66031090e7b8449

commit_message:
Migrate timecost decorator to neutron-lib

There are a few functions in neutron-lib where timecost profiling would
be beneficial, so that means it is a good time to transition this
library to neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I7c84a83a2f836493f63b220f7ff0cbcc823374f2

commit_message:
Add capability to retrieve rows from databases

Adding the capability to retrieve a list of tables, list of rows,
and the table schema information from a given database backup
archive file, for the purpose of manual database table/row
restoration and also for just viewing.

This is added to the HTK _restore_main.sh.tpl and is integrated
into the Postgresql restore script (Mariadb will be done later).

Change-Id: I729ecf7a720f1847a431de7e149cec6841ec67b8

subject: Remove <py3.5 dependencies from requirements.txt
messages:
[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 19:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-02 19:59:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

If this works we know what to do to fix it:

Our requirements.txt must only support > py3.5 so that it can be validated by the check requirements job

For python2.7 packagers or python3.2 packagers or anyone < 3.3 they'll need to know about the external dependency on ipaddress"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-02 22:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-02 22:06:23.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

we won't need this if Tim removes his -2 from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/732989/ ;)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 19:42:31.000000000', 'message': 'Enable requirements check again

This reverts Ibf8000498528c401707be8b0b91b8355cd993786.

Change-Id: Id6b5f535af27c64e6f097a70005f7572fb2f59e3
'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 22:02:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove <py3.5 dependencies from requirements.txt

The requirements repo is support python 3.5 as oldest python version
while swift still supports py27.

thus, requirements-check will fail on a couple of lines in swift.  The
check is only run when these files are touched.

The py2.7 packagers we know about aren't depending on upstream
requirements.txt for correctness and aside from all the production
deployments running on py2.7 we only realistically support >=py3.7

There's no good reason for our requirements.txt to be "unspported" by
the openstack requirements check job.  Since they only support >=py3.5
we can change our requirements.txt inline with that.  This should be
fine for everything we could hope to get out of both our
requirements.txt and the check!

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id6b5f535af27c64e6f097a70005f7572fb2f59e3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove <py3.5 dependencies from requirements.txt

The requirements repo is support python 3.5 as oldest python version
while swift still supports py27.

thus, requirements-check will fail on a couple of lines in swift.  The
check is only run when these files are touched.

The py2.7 packagers we know about aren't depending on upstream
requirements.txt for correctness and aside from all the production
deployments running on py2.7 we only realistically support >=py3.7

There's no good reason for our requirements.txt to be "unspported" by
the openstack requirements check job.  Since they only support >=py3.5
we can change our requirements.txt inline with that.  This should be
fine for everything we could hope to get out of both our
requirements.txt and the check!

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id6b5f535af27c64e6f097a70005f7572fb2f59e3

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-23 16:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-05-25 17:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-29 08:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-06-02 21:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-23 16:06:08.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7382e562d05010938377815e3dfa37c84d1d485d
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7382e562d05010938377815e3dfa37c84d1d485d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 14:58:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix OSJournalHandler() PEP8 issue

The commit [0] to oslo.log added a new parameter called "facility" to
the OSJournalHandler() class constructor. The new parameter does not
have a default value which is causing pep8 to fail.

This change adds a try...except block around the instantiation of this
class so that it would also work with older versions of oslo.log. This
fallback code should be deleted in the future, a note was left in code.

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/5b12e66f6283962d96884e4aa3fa7db7d4e062fa

Change-Id: I43d738d9d03a85c499ecadf53310d347c215ecb5
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix OSJournalHandler() PEP8 issue

The commit [0] to oslo.log added a new parameter called "facility" to
the OSJournalHandler() class constructor. The new parameter does not
have a default value which is causing pep8 to fail.

This change adds a try...except block around the instantiation of this
class so that it would also work with older versions of oslo.log. This
fallback code should be deleted in the future, a note was left in code.

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/5b12e66f6283962d96884e4aa3fa7db7d4e062fa

Change-Id: I43d738d9d03a85c499ecadf53310d347c215ecb5
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 17:07:09.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version and use it
instead of retired oslosphinx. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I8e9ad94f6e0586fbb50512515f3a33136c4502b1

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version and use it
instead of retired oslosphinx. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Add .zuul.yaml with specs-jobs template so that this repo has jobs.

Change-Id: I8e9ad94f6e0586fbb50512515f3a33136c4502b1

commit_message:
Update the min version of tox to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0. Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: Ie751f24ddd03cf3150b31ed91b9c90a51b207445

[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:08:42.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I7fa3bef0c7acd2b1f781bf12cc5a653cbc51d8c5
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I7fa3bef0c7acd2b1f781bf12cc5a653cbc51d8c5

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I61c96d3f8479b6ab5eef993a769f1fc7df78c6ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-06 23:30:33.000000000', 'message': "Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request

EC2 token requests contain a signature that signs the entire request,
including the access timestamp. While the signature is checked, the
timestamp is not, and so these signed requests remain valid
indefinitely, leaving the token API vulnerable to replay attacks. This
change introduces a configurable TTL for signed token requests and
ensures that the timestamp is actually validated against it.

The check will work for either an AWS Signature v1/v2 'Timestamp'
parameter[1] or the AWS Signature v4 'X-Aws-Date' header or
parameter[2].

Although this technically adds a new feature and the default value of
the feature changes behavior, this change is required to protect
credential holders and therefore must be backported to all supported
branches.

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/signature-version-2.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-date-handling.html

Conflicts due to six removal in e2d83ae9:
	keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py
	keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_ec2_core.py

Conflicts due to flask reorg:
	keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py

commit_message:
Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request

EC2 token requests contain a signature that signs the entire request,
including the access timestamp. While the signature is checked, the
timestamp is not, and so these signed requests remain valid
indefinitely, leaving the token API vulnerable to replay attacks. This
change introduces a configurable TTL for signed token requests and
ensures that the timestamp is actually validated against it.

The check will work for either an AWS Signature v1/v2 'Timestamp'
parameter[1] or the AWS Signature v4 'X-Aws-Date' header or
parameter[2].

Although this technically adds a new feature and the default value of
the feature changes behavior, this change is required to protect
credential holders and therefore must be backported to all supported
branches.

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/signature-version-2.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-date-handling.html

Conflicts due to six removal in e2d83ae9:
	keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py
	keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_ec2_core.py

Conflicts due to v2.0 API testing in stable/queens. The v2.0 tests were
removed in Rocky but in earlier releases we tested similar functionality
between v3 and v2.0. This conflict was resolved by porting the timestamp
to the v2.0 API test:
	keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_ec2_core.py

Conflicts due to flask reorg:
	keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: I866537f6b9d8a0fdb080f5abce938afb2ebdf68b

This submission addressess an issue whereby service level was
not returned on occassion, service level and workload are now
returned for all volumes in the metadata tables when debug
mode is enabled. The compression attribute has also been
standardised to bring it in line with metadata set on
volumes. Both places now have the attribute 'compression
disabled'.

Change-Id: I04d20c0c59f8269663fb829319bea1087619d2e2
(cherry picked from commit f1eb128c821c257ab035518f34b7df269eaa7cdd)
"}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Debug Metadata Fix

This submission addressess an issue whereby service level was
not returned on occassion, service level and workload are now
returned for all volumes in the metadata tables when debug
mode is enabled. The compression attribute has also been
standardised to bring it in line with metadata set on
volumes. Both places now have the attribute 'compression
disabled'.

Change-Id: I04d20c0c59f8269663fb829319bea1087619d2e2
(cherry picked from commit f1eb128c821c257ab035518f34b7df269eaa7cdd)

commit_message:
Update include

Ansible is deprecating include, replace it with
include_task/import_playbook.

Change-Id: If9e9a5ff7918ae88b39d4fa225986bd3149301f4

commit_message:
Ensure bootstrapped OSD presented to ceph-mon

On charm upgrade ensure that the number of bootstrapped OSD's
is presented to the ceph-mon application.

This ensures that the ceph-mon application does not switch
into a 'waiting' state after upgrade from earlier versions
of the ceph-* charms.

Change-Id: If1425ef837a74212f002985f648ac1ecf9257201
Closes-Bug: 1861996

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-24 04:55:20.000000000', 'message': 'feat(tls): add cert manager helm clean up parameter

The default cert manager leaves behind secrets generated by the
certificate declared in the chart when the release is deleted. This adds
the ownership of the secrets by the certificate so they can be properly
clean up when the chart is uninstalled.

This also adds linebreaks for readability.

Change-Id: Id40d504251bbd98c32a7d9baa3dbe9858ad495cb
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-05-24 23:28:38.000000000', 'message': 'feat(tls): add additional parameters to chart deployment

This patch set adds in two additional parameters to:

a. establish ownership between certificate and secret so secrets can be
   cleaned up when the certificate is deleted as part of a helm release
b. add the ability to always issue new tls.key as part of the key

This also adds linebreaks for readability.

commit_message:
feat(tls): add additional parameters to chart deployment

This patch set adds in two additional parameters to:

a. establish ownership between certificate and secret so secrets can be
   cleaned up when the certificate is deleted as part of a helm release
b. add the ability to always issue new tls.key as part of the key
   rotation when the secret gets regenerated for any reason.

This also adds linebreaks for readability.

Change-Id: Id40d504251bbd98c32a7d9baa3dbe9858ad495cb
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Exclude callbacks env vars for ceph-ansible

We're working on changing the default callbacks for tripleo but we don't
want to use them when invoking ceph-ansible. We should exclude the
callbacks that were used in the calling env and specifically set the
regular callbacks.

Change-Id: I6ab1709d2e0e0d60d2401281aa3bb88cfea6e5d4
Related-Bug: #1881670

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ibaaacbc2fd1f618d91818bf30ba887218b52535b

feat(tls): add certificate tooling

This patch set adds in a manifest method in helm toolkit to generate
certificates and places them into a secret.

Change-Id: I50300afb0fc0ab92169ad9dd9ba66a56454fbc46
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I6432464dfb482ceff522c31a9eb6e6993766f07e

[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105

Change-Id: Ib5954dc2cd7ef5eb736efbf5fb0a8e92b4d7f579
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ib5954dc2cd7ef5eb736efbf5fb0a8e92b4d7f579

commit_message:
fix(yaml): correct bad annotations

In a recent apparmor security patch [0], additional annotations were
added to the cronjobs that were incorrectly indented. While helm v2
seems fairly tolerant and ignores these errors, running this usig helm
v3 seems to cause rendering problems as we are placing incorrect key
and value pair into the spec: field. This patch set corrects this.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/725727/8

Change-Id: I9aae94bc0a68318b2c16fedbc973f7a0a2a3729e
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Use force OPTIONS to install the jq

when the force is yes, get_url moudel will download the file
every time and replace the file if the contents change, so it's
not necessary to remove the jq before get it.

Change-Id: I7337afecd1f9d7c66da46bff433016a39fd9ef7a

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I8c2ffea3c31b3009c87455d9c54dc233367f0d3d
Closes-Bug: #1863021

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-06 22:37:14.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected

Without this patch, when an OAuth1 request token is authorized with a
limited set of roles, the roles for the access token are ignored when
the user uses it to request a keystone token. This means that user of an
access token can use it to escallate their role assignments beyond what
was authorized by the creator. This patch fixes the issue by ensuring
the token model accounts for an OAuth1-scoped token and correctly
populating the roles for it.

Modified to work with older test helper function:

  keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py

Change-Id: I02f9836fbd4d7e629653977fc341476cfd89859e
Closes-bug: #1873290
(cherry picked from commit 6c73690f779a42a5c62914b6bc37f0ac2f41a3e3)
(cherry picked from commit ba89d27793c2d3a26ad95642660fa9bd820ed3be)
(cherry picked from commit 5ff52dbaa2082991d229d8557a8e4b65256d6c53)
(cherry picked from commit 2483a578a80a916d9f5acd672d85830385b236e2)
(cherry picked from commit 10bc689a6796f85c44d19e0c18f0e37b0a87474c)
'}, {'created': '2020-05-07 05:08:09.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected

Without this patch, when an OAuth1 request token is authorized with a
limited set of roles, the roles for the access token are ignored when
the user uses it to request a keystone token. This means that user of an
access token can use it to escallate their role assignments beyond what
was authorized by the creator. This patch fixes the issue by ensuring
the token model accounts for an OAuth1-scoped token and correctly

commit_message:
Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected

Without this patch, when an OAuth1 request token is authorized with a
limited set of roles, the roles for the access token are ignored when
the user uses it to request a keystone token. This means that user of an
access token can use it to escallate their role assignments beyond what
was authorized by the creator. This patch fixes the issue by ensuring
the token model accounts for an OAuth1-scoped token and correctly
populating the roles for it.

Modified to work with older test helper function:

  keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py

Conflicts:

  keystone/models/token_model.py

  The keystone token model was refactored in the Rocky release. This
  commit only backports the test so that we have test coverage against
  the bug and proves there wasn't a regression in Queens. As such, the
  code changes to token_model.py (where the bug was introduced) are not
  applicable to Pike.

  releasenotes/notes/bug-1873290-ff7f8e4cee15b75a.yaml

  Removed the release note since there isn't anything to signal to
  operators regarding a vulnerability. We're only adding test coverage
  to prove that stable/queens isn't vulnerable.

Change-Id: I02f9836fbd4d7e629653977fc341476cfd89859e
Closes-bug: #1873290
(cherry picked from commit 6c73690f779a42a5c62914b6bc37f0ac2f41a3e3)
(cherry picked from commit ba89d27793c2d3a26ad95642660fa9bd820ed3be)

commit_message:
Switch to new grenade job name

The integrated gate template (integrated-gate-py3) has been switched
to the new grenade name (grenade-py3 -> grenade). This repo uses the
template but also has for irrelevant files an extra entry.

Rename the job following the template change to avoid duplicate
grenade runs.

Details:
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/725148
Change-Id: I52ebbcae0d77c0420848a37babc73bb75dd58e0b
(cherry picked from commit 2b4e53792d75bc02a47b0caf2b53d3cb55b53737)

commit_message:
Remove inject_file from compute manager and virt driver

The inject_file call was removed from the compute RPC at 3.18.
As we have RCP 5.x now it is safe to remove the manager method
handing that call. This removes the last user of the inject_file virt
diver method so that is deleted too.

Change-Id: If257fa301e8c12bb0c5e4d396ccc2c7277b25233

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-29 13:01:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix system ca bundle for the correct python version

When the default python3 version is being overridden by e.g. setting

PYTHON3_VERSION=3.7

we need to fix the correct ca bundle, not the one for the default
python3 installation, which e.g. on Ubuntu 18.04 will be python3.6.

Change-Id: I25dbcdc56b4390eebc731a192d108674e2b8c625
'}]
commit_message:
Fix system ca bundle for the correct python version

When the default python3 version is being overridden by e.g. setting

PYTHON3_VERSION=3.7

we need to fix the correct ca bundle, not the one for the default
python3 installation, which e.g. on Ubuntu 18.04 will be python3.6.

Change-Id: I25dbcdc56b4390eebc731a192d108674e2b8c625

commit_message:
Fix for auth during live-migration (2)

Post step could fail due to auth token expiration.
setup_networks_on_host fails with authentication required,
because there are some calls to neutron api using token
from request context. This patch change that calls to use
admin context.

Corresponding-patch:
Review - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/407147/
Commit - 4a5ecf1e29c3bdbb022f98a5fba41d4e7df56d88

Change-Id: I4d83a70c01f7ba943daa85c3777376380594b3f7
Closes-bug: #1647451

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in test/unit/common tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(x in y) to assertIn(x, y).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail

Change-Id: I3aef5fe9776eb6b4a6a3f28d17813253684bee61

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(xyz is None) to assertIsNone(xyz).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I61d3b294cc74546f03578ca1942434fa3024c89b

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-06-02 13:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-06-02 15:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 12:34:31.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I25dd42f39618163dff6a8d541017a9eb80adafd2
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I25dd42f39618163dff6a8d541017a9eb80adafd2

This will obviously need test coverage (and fixes)."}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-31 08:29:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

> (1 comment)

 > To be clear, we're doing this because cinder has a new image format
 > that nova doesn't (can't) support yet, so we're putting a fast-fail
 > check in place?
 > 
 > This will obviously need test coverage (and fixes).

Yes, but it is not a *container* format, image format is not changed."}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-31 15:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-31 15:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

And I suspect pep8 might ding you for redundant parens.'}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-31 16:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> This looks sane at this point.
 > 
 > Still needs test coverage.
 > 
 > And I suspect pep8 might ding you for redundant parens.

Thanks! I will check for pep8 and compose testing.
May I ask what kind of testing should I do?'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-07-31 16:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-34538 : SUCCESS in 1h 04m 51s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-31 16:27:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Well, I was going to say you should write a functional test that tries to build an instance with a (fake) compressed image and shows that it errors properly.

But that led me to look at your change a bit more closely, and I now think we probably want to move this check to a different place.

As written, I think what will happen is your instance will go into error state, possibly after trying all three alternate hosts. Considering this patch is trying to declare wholesale non support for compressed images, it would be better to do the check at the conductor/api level and fail the spawn operation before it even gets started.

There's a spot where we do early validation of flavor/image for a boot request. When I get back to my desk I'll try to track that down for you if you haven't already found it."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-07-31 18:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/673407/3 : FAILURE in 2h 26m 28s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-31 20:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Here's the API-side validation routine I was talking about [1]. So I think you should move this check under there. And whereas it appears the other validation code there is tested via unit tests, IMO it would still be more appropriate to do a simple functional test that tries to create a server with a compressed image and proves that it bounces.

commit_message:
Check container_format on instance creation

Currently nova doesn't support new container format
'compressed'. And if we're trying to create a new instance
directly from a image which is in 'compressed' container
format, creation will be done successfully. However this
instance is not really valid.

This patch is to simply abort instance creation directly from
image if container_format of the image is 'compressed'.
Error number 400 will be thrown while creating or rebuilding a
server with image in 'compressed' format.

Functional test for this patch included.

To support cinder patch [0, 1]:
[0] spec: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652275
[1] code: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668825
To support glance patch [2]:
[2] spec-lite: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670454

Change-Id: I3d1b174718d0c10d7e70de2bb0ceb6678e97f7ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 12:37:01.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I350ff814a1040403b3ff633e63d718f6af5b31b5
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I350ff814a1040403b3ff633e63d718f6af5b31b5
