commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I160c83cad6391c988b8b36e4bac346f11b8fc8fb

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I953c3393b32a48b1846d4bcb0159c1e3d5806beb

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I3400fdd27d6731d6d4aab5e72b343fc209f25a9b

[{'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2020-05-29 18:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2020-05-29 18:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

a testproject will be posted later...

local test...

- hosts: localhost
  vars:
    iterations:
      - 1
      - 2
      - 3
  tasks:
    - name: Look for missing directories
      shell: |
        echo {{ item }}
        exit $(($RANDOM%2))
      register: files_missing
      changed_when: false
      ignore_errors: True
      loop: "{{ iterations }}"

    - name: Show if missing files
      debug:
        msg: "WARNING: One or more files are missing on the overcloud image."
      when: "item['rc'] == 1"
      loop: "{{ files_missing.results }}"'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2020-05-29 19:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-06-01 07:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Resume when image sanity fails

In non-periodic jobs do not fail when files are missing in the
overcloud image. Instead, display a warning message.

Fail only in periodic jobs as we don't want to promote bad images.

The missing files issue is still unkown.

Related-Bug: #1881090

Change-Id: I5a496f44aa36daaa609cdfb29ffe3a3eace7a41e

commit_message:
Ingress: Use latest controller image

Use nginx-ingress-controller:0.32.0 and change user to 101
intead of 33 which is suported by this image.

Change-Id: I38679e350ec352f13074055b7e08b98df1090fbf

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: I9077f5edf02341cc16efcdac3da0a442a7527594
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix the smoke test bundle

* remove resources from the smoke test bundle
  * attach_saml_resources step in Zaza does it https://git.io/JfKTp
* use the same set of applications in the smoke bundle so that configure
  steps and func tests pass.

Change-Id: Ic5c7bbb479197b7bc7161c2cd6090984901fa2b6
Closes-Bug: #1881267

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 17:51:35.000000000', 'message': "hacking: Modify checks for translated logs

The N319 check previously asserted that debug-level logs were not
translated. Now that we've removed all log translations, we can
generalize this to all logs. We reuse the same number since these
numbers are really just metadata and not public contracts.

This also allows us to update the N323 and N326 checks, which ensure we
import the translation function, '_', wherever it's used and don't
concatenate translated and non-translated strings. Since we're no longer
translating logs and the '_LE', '_LW' and '_LI' symbols are no longer
provided, we don't need to consider logs in either of these cases.

Change-Id: I64d139ad660bc382e8b9d7c8cd03352b26aadafd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-05-20 16:33:15.000000000', 'message': "hacking: Modify checks for translated logs

commit_message:
hacking: Modify checks for translated logs

The N319 check previously asserted that debug-level logs were not
translated. Now that we've removed all log translations, we can
generalize this to all logs. We reuse the same number since these
numbers are really just metadata and not public contracts.

This also allows us to update the N323 and N326 checks, which ensure we
import the translation function, '_', wherever it's used and don't
concatenate translated and non-translated strings. Since we're no longer
translating logs and the '_LE', '_LW' and '_LI' symbols are no longer
provided, we don't need to consider logs in either of these cases.

Change-Id: I64d139ad660bc382e8b9d7c8cd03352b26aadafd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 11:12:09.000000000', 'message': "docs: Remove subtitles, metadata from man pages

These do not render correctly when generating man pages and likely exist
from a time when the pages were built with rst2man (i.e. docutils)
instead of Sphinx. They're not necessary when using Sphinx since that
information is provided via the 'man_pages' config option in 'conf.py',
which are updated here to reflect reality.

Change-Id: I133e7231112cc9025e57a29d43bfa7002ca775e7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Remove subtitles, metadata from man pages

These do not render correctly when generating man pages and likely exist
from a time when the pages were built with rst2man (i.e. docutils)
instead of Sphinx. They're not necessary when using Sphinx since that
information is provided via the 'man_pages' config option in 'conf.py',
which are updated here to reflect reality.

Change-Id: I133e7231112cc9025e57a29d43bfa7002ca775e7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow {{network.name}}InterfaceDefaultRoute overriding by parameter

Currently {{network.name}}InterfaceDefaultRoute can be specified only
by network_data.yaml, and can't be oberridden by a template parameter.

This patch allows overriding the parameter by a template parameter, to
provide a consistent experience about network parameters in templates.

Change-Id: Iff5fdcc4007013c2794cd22e26f71aba8745a278

commit_message:
Release final python-magnumclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Ic12fd29b1258c794a09987fc18a322c618c5ef7e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 15:22:47.000000000', 'message': "Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
"}, {'created': '2020-04-02 12:39:58.000000000', 'message': "Avoid unconditional fact gathering

uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2020-06-02 13:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 12:05:24.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I70aec0472ce090cb54855c58f20f4f02e20ae2c2
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I70aec0472ce090cb54855c58f20f4f02e20ae2c2

commit_message:
Do not crash on privmsg with no content

There is a corner case (/dcc chat) where a privmsg can have no content.
Ignore such corner cases instead of crashing.

Change-Id: Ia07c76c4a2342bb4e7bc9c37a4944d4b9f18efd8

commit_message:
Fix redfish-virtual-media file permission

When not using swift with the redfish virtual media boot interface,
in other words local file storage, the file permissions for the
/httpboot/redfish folder was incorrect upon initially being created,
and new file ISOs were being created with permissions based upon the
conductor process umask value which is OS environment dependent.

Change-Id: I038ca335efa9b5443469ab8c8af12863deea0e38

commit_message:
Add `network_data` ironic node attribute support

Adds support for adding static network configuration to ironic node
object by adding ``network-data`` attribute to "node" osc
command.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687910/
Change-Id: I771911cbc2cfaef2cbac841fc76971e042c010c1
Story: 2006691
Task: 37072

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-31 17:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 09:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2020-06-02 12:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-31 17:48:23.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I002235658290ffd494f4507dc0a6c78f94794b19
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I002235658290ffd494f4507dc0a6c78f94794b19

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iabe6f531dcae728331698e7c70ad81adb86315cf
